message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int cn=0; cn<row.getLastCellNum(); cn++) {
   Cell cell = row.getCell(cn, Row.MissingCellPolicy.CREATE_NULL_AS_BLANK);
   System.out.println("CELL:-->"+cell.toString());
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of using cellIterator(), you can use a for loop to iterate over the cells in the row. The method getCell(int cellnum, Row.MissingCellPolicy policy) can be used to handle missing or blank cells. If the cell is missing in the file, it returns a new, blank cell. If the cell physically exists in the file, it returns that cell, otherwise, it returns null.
